bug.author: monchier
bug.summary: When maximizing an altair chart the aspect ratio is not maintained.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
st.altair_chart should maintain the aspect ratio when maximized. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>import streamlit as st import numpy as np import pandas as pd import altair as alt
df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(200, 3), columns=["a", "b", "c"])
c = alt.Chart(df).mark_circle().encode(x="a", y="b", size="c", color="c")
st.altair_chart(c, width=-1) </denchmark-code>
Open the UI and click on the maximize button <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
It should display a square chart <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
It displays a tall and narrow chart. Before maximizing: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6821233/67708752-ec294f00-f979-11e9-8ac6-0555b7627849.png></denchmark-link>
After Maximizing: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6821233/67708764-f0ee0300-f979-11e9-8330-cf772516fccb.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
Not sure. It may be. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: ad5f388 Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: Browser version:
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
Unsure the width=-1 behavior is the expected one from start. <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/something-not-working-with-altair-chart-height-past-v0-47-4/720/6>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/something-not-working-with-altair-chart-height-past-v0-47-4/720/6</denchmark-link>
